title.rendered: Delhi vs Punjab: Fantasy Cricket Tips, Pitch Report, Playing XIs for Today’s Match: Indian T20 League 2022

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Delhi vs Punjab Pitch Report for Today’s Match

The last game at the Brabourne Stadium produced a century and a hat-trick. The pitch could not be flatter, and yet Yuzvendra Chahal proved that a bowler can deceive a batter in any given condition.

Time: April 20, 7:30 PM IST

Delhi vs Punjab Probable Playing XIs

With Mitchell Marsh unavailable due to COVID-19 infection, Tim Seifert is likely to get the nod. He scored a brisk 21 against Mumbai last month.

Probable XI for Delhi: Prithvi Shaw, David Warner*, Tim Seifert*, Rishabh Pant (c & wk), Rovman Powell*, Lalit Yadav, Axar Patel, Shardul Thakur, Kuldeep Yadav, Mustafizur Rahman*, Khaleel Ahmed

Probable XI for Punjab: Shikhar Dhawan (c), Prabhsimran Singh, Jonny Bairstow*, Liam Livingstone*, Jitesh Sharma (wk), Shahrukh Khan, Odean Smith*, Kagiso Rabada*, Rahul Chahar, Vaibhav Arora, Arshdeep Singh

Power Players for Delhi vs Punjab Match

Liam Livingstone has scored three fifties in six games, but all these knocks came in the first innings. He wouldn’t bat any differently in the second innings: he likes to go bonkers irrespective of the match situation. If the conditions demand, he can also roll his arm over. He has two wickets at 11 to his name.

Another batter who falls in the same category is Prithvi Shaw. He has scored the bulk of the runs for Delhi: 176 runs with a strike rate of 164.

Kuldeep Yadav has silenced all the critics with his consistent and courageous bowling. With 11 wickets at 14, he is the third-highest wicket-taker.

David Warner, like Kuldeep, too has made amends for the lost opportunity in the previous season. He collected consecutive 60-plus scores, setting a solid base for the middle-order to exploit.

Smart Picks for Delhi vs Punjab Match

Barring Delhi’s opening game, Rishabh Pant has been a part of the Ultimate Team on My11Circle. He has scored 144 runs at an impressive average of 36.

Shikhar Dhawan has four scores above 30 runs in six games. His average has not dropped below 30 since the 2015 season.

Rahul Chahar has gone wicketless only once in six games. Overall, he has taken 9 wickets and maintained an economy of 7.2.

Khaleel Ahmed’s 8 of 5 wickets have come in the powerplay. Along with his natural in-swinger, he has now learnt to take the ball away from a right-hander.

Mayank Agarwal won the Player of the Match award for his half-century, two catches and a run-out against Mumbai. After a hat-trick of low scores, the innings must have boosted his confidence.

Shardul Thakur has been a better batter than a bowler for a year or so in shorter formats. He has hit five sixes in as many games. His highest score reads 29*.

Also read:

Mumbai vs Chennai Fantasy Cricket Tips

Delhi vs Punjab Match Preview

Punjab’s three wins have been convincing, but they still have a few chinks in their armour. On the other hand, Delhi have lacked teeth and on most occasions failed to play as a cohesive team.

Play Delhi vs Punjab on fantasy cricket app now!

New to fantasy cricket? Learn how to play fantasy cricket and get started.
